li.text: NIUNIT=100, The length of the IUNIT array and related arrays and thus the maximum number of possible packages.
NCOL - Number of columns in the grid.
NROW - Number of rows in the grid.
NLAY - Number of layers in the grid.
NPER - Number of stress periods.
NBOTM - Number of simulated layers plus number of confining beds.
NCNFBD - Number of confining beds

ITMUNI - ITMUNI is a code which indicates units of time used in the input data. This code is only used to print a table showing elapsed time in seconds, minutes, hours, days, and years. It is not used in formulating or solving the finite-difference equation.
LENUNI - LENUNI indicates the length unit of model data, which must be consistent for all data values that involve length.
IXSEC - IXSEC is a flag that indicates whether or not the model is a cross sectional model.
ITRSS - a flag indicating whether the model is a steady-state model, transient model, or combined steady-state and transient model.
INBAS - input file unit for the basic package.
IFREFM - a flag indicating whether or not free format is used
NODES - Number of cells (nodes) in the finite-difference grid.
IOUT - Primary unit number for all printed output.
MXITER -

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: MXITER is the maximum number of times through the iteration loop in one time step in an attempt to solve the system of finite-difference equations.
IUNIT(NIUNIT) - IUNIT is a table that indicates which major options are to be used and the unit numbers from which input is to be read.

HNEW(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - HNEW is an array containing the latest estimates of heads. It starts each time step with heads calculated for the end of the previous time step. It is changed at each iteration until the last iteration when it contains the heads at the end of the time step.
LBOTM(NLAY) - points to the array for the bottom of a layer. For example if a model has two layers with a non-simulated confining bed between the layers, LBOTM would be (1,3).

LAYCBD(NLAY) - LAYCBD is a flag, with one value for each model layer, that indicates whether or not a layer has a Quasi-3D confining bed below it. 0 indicates no confining bed, and not zero indicates a confining bed. LAYCBD for the bottom layer must be 0.
LAYHDT(NLAY) - LAYHDT is a flag indicating whether or not the transmissivity depends on head.

para.text: 0 - transmissivity does not depend on head

li.text: LAYHDS(NLAY) - LAYHDS is a flag indicating whether or not the storage coefficient depends on head. (LAYHDS is set by each of the flow packages in MODFLOW-2005 but is never used in MODFLOW-2005.)

para.text: 0 - storage coefficient does not depend on head

li.text: PERLEN(NPER) - PERLEN is the length of a stress period.
NSTP(NPER) - NSTP is the number of time steps in a stress period.
TSMULT(NPER) -

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: TSMULT is the multiplier for the length of successive time steps. The length of a time step is calculated by multiplying the length of the previous time step by TSMULT.
ISSFLG(NPER) - ISSFLG is a flag indicating whether or not a particular stress period is steady-state or transient
DELR(NCOL) - DELR is the cell width along rows. Read one value for each of the NCOL columns. This is a multi-value one-dimensional variable with one value for each column.
DELC(NROW) - DELC is the cell width along columns. Read one value for each of the NROW rows. This is a multi-value one-dimensional variable with one value for each row.
BOTM(NCOL,NROW,0:NBOTM) - BOTM is the bottom elevation of a model layer or a Quasi-3d confining bed.

HOLD(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - HOLD is an array containing heads at the beginning of the current time step. At the beginning of a time step, HOLD AND HNEW contain identical values. HNEW changes from one iteration to the next; HOLD does not.
IBOUND(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - IBOUND is the boundary variable.

para.text: If IBOUND(J,I,K) < 0, cell J,I,K has a constant head.
If IBOUND(J,I,K) = 0, cell J,I,K is inactive.
If IBOUND(J,I,K) > 0, cell J,I,K is active.

li.text: CR(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - Branch Conductance in the Row Direction
CC(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - Branch Conductance in the Column Direction
CV(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - Vertical Branch Conductance between a layer and the next lower layer
HCOF(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - Coefficient of head in cell (J,I,K) in the finite-difference equation.
RHS(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - RHS is an array which contains the right hand side of each finite-difference equation. RHS is an accumulation of terms from several different packages.
BUFF(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - BUFFER is an array in which data are temporarily stored while they are being gathered for printing.
STRT(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - STRT is initial (starting) head—that is, head at the beginning of the simulation.
DDREF(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - DDREF is the reference head used to calculate drawdown.
GLOBALDAT(10) - an array of GLOBALTYPE for multiple grids
GLOBALTYPE
MXPAR=2000, Maximum number of parameters
MXCLST=20000, Maximum number of clusters
MXINST=50000, Maximun number of parameter instances
ICLSUM - ICLSUM is the last unused position in array of parameter clusters
IPSUM - IPSUM is the last unused position in array of parameter names
INAMLOC - INAMLOC is the last unused position in array of instance names
NMLTAR - NMLTAR is the number of multiplier arrays
NZONAR - NZONAR is the number of zone arrays
NPVAL - NPVAL is the number of parameters listed in the parameter value file.
B(MXPAR) - B is the array of parameter values.
IACTIVE(MXPAR) - IACTIVE is set to a value greater than zero if a parameter is active in a stress period.
IPLOC(4,MXPAR) - IPLOC points to the positions of the data that define a parameter

para.text: IPLOC(4,*) - location of the first instance name

li.text: IPCLST(14,MXCLST) the data that defines a cluster

para.text: IPCLST(2,*) - multiplier array number, 0 means no multiplier array
IPCLST(3,*) - zone array number, 0 means no zone array
IPCLST(4,*) - position in IPCLST of the last zone for the cluster

li.text: IZON(NCOL,NROW,NZONAR) - the zone arrays
RMLT(NCOL,NROW,NMLTAR) - the multiplier arrays
PARNAM(MXPAR) - the parameter names
PARTYP(MXPAR) - the parameter types
ZONNAM(NZONAR) - the zone array names
MLTNAM(NMLTAR) - the multiplier array names
INAME(MXINST) - the instance names
PARAMDAT(10) - an array of PARAMTYPE for multiple grids
PARAMTYPE
MSUM - budget term counter
IHEDFM - Format code for printing head.
IHEDUN - Unit number for file where heads will be saved.
IDDNFM - Format code for printing drawdown.
IDDNUN - Unit number for file where drawdown will be saved.
IBOUUN - Unit number where IBOUND will be saved.
LBHDSV - A flag that indicates whether or not heads should be labeled in the output file
LBDDSV - A flag that indicates whether or not drawdown should be labeled in the output file
LBBOSV - A flag that indicates whether or not IBOUND should be labeled in the output file
IBUDFL - Total Budget Printout Flag
ICBCFL- Cell-By-Cell Flow Term Flag
IHDDFL - Head/Drawdown Printout Flag
IAUXSV - Flag to save Auxiliary Data in Cell-By-Cell Budget Files
IBDOPT - Flag for using compact budget format
IPRTIM - Flag for printing total execution time
IPEROC - Period number at which output is desired.
ITSOC - Time step number at which output is desired
ICHFLG - Flag that indicates whether flow between adjacent constant-head cells should be calculated.
IDDREF - flag that indicates whether the current heads are to be used as the reference heads for calculating drawdown.

para.text: 0 - do not use as reference heads

li.text: IDDREFNEW - flag that indicates whether the heads calculated at the associated stress period and time step are to be used as the reference heads for calculating drawdown.

para.text: 0 - do not use as reference heads

li.text: DELT - length of the current time step
PERTIM - length of the current stress period
TOTIM - total elapsed simulation time
HNOFLO - head assigned to cells that are inactive.
HDRY - head assigned to cells that have converted to dry
CHEDFM - Format used for saving heads
CDDNFM - Format used for saving drawdown
CBOUFM - Format used for saving IBOUND
IOFLG(:NLAY,5) - Flags for printing or saving data. If the corresponding flag is 0, the item will not be printed or saved. If the corresponding flag is not 0, the item will be printed or saved.
VBVL(4,NIUNIT) - Budget accumulator
VBNM(NIUNIT) - Budget term labels.
PARAMDAT(10) - an array of GWFBASDAT for multiple grids
GWFBASTYPE
GWF2BAS7AR - Allocate and Read for GWF Basic Package
GWF2BAS7ST - Setup Time Variables for New Time Period
GWF2BAS7AD - Advance to Next Time Step
GWF2BAS7FM - Set HCOF=RHS=0.
GWF2BAS7OC - Output Controller for Head, Drawdown, and Budget
GWF2BAS7OT - Output Time, Volumetric Budget, Head, and Drawdown
SGWF2BAS7ARDIS - Allocate and Read Dis Data
SGWF2BAS7D - Calculate, Print, And Save Drawdowns
SGWF2BAS7H - Print And Record Heads
SGWF2BAS7IB - Record IBOUND
SGWF2BAS7I - Set Up Output Control
SGWF2BAS7J - Read Initial Alphabetic Output Control Records
SGWF2BAS7T - Print Simulation Time
SGWF2BAS7V - Print Volumetric Budget
SGWF2BAS7N - Set Output Flags Using Alphabetic Output Control Input Structure
SGWF2BAS7L - When Using Alphabetic Output Control, Decode Layer Number for Printing or Saving Head or Drawdown
SGWF2BAS7OPEN - Open Files
SGWF2BAS7ARMZ - Allocate and Read Multiplier and Zone Arrays
SGWF2BAS7ARPVAL - Read Parameter Input File
SGWF2BAS7STPVAL - Check that Parameter Definitions are Complete
GWF2BAS7DA - Deallocate Global Data
SGWF2BAS7PNT - Change Global Data to a Different Grid
SGWF2BAS7PSV - Save Global Data for a Grid.
